name: Bimal Kumar Roy
content: Bimal Kumar Roy Professor, Applied Statistics Unit, Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata Head, Cryptology Research Group, Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata Founder and General-Secretary, Cryptology Research Society of India Address Applied Statistics Unit Indian Statistical Institute 203 Barackpore Trunk Road Kolkata, West Bengal, India 700108 Office Applied Statistics Unit, Eighth Floor S N Bose Building (Library Building) Phone +91 (33) 2575 2809 (office) Fax +91 (33) 2578 5260 (office) Email bimal@isical.ac.in Website http://www.isical.ac.in/~bimal Educational Qualifications Ph.D. in Combinatorics from University of Waterloo, Canada, in 1982. Master of Statistics from Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata, in 1979. Bachelor of Statistics from Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata, in 1978. Academic Positions Professor, Applied Statistics Unit, Indian Statistical Institute since 1997. Head, R C Bose Centre for Cryptology and Security, ISI Kolkata, 2015-2021. Director, Indian Statistical Institute, 2010-2015. Associate Prof., Dept. of Computer Science, State University of USA, 1990-1991. Associate Prof., Computer Science Unit, Indian Statistical Institute, 1989-1997. Lecturer, Computer Science Unit, Indian Statistical Institute, 1984-1989. Assistant Prof., Dept. of Computer Science, SUNY at Utica, 1982-1984. For further details, check my Curriculum Vitae (in PDF format). Padma Shri Award, Government of India, 2015. Teacherâs Award, Indian National Science Academy, 2014. Fellow, Indian Society for Probability and Statistics, since 2014. Fellow, National Academy of Sciences, India, since 2010. Reliance Platinum Jubilee Award, National Academy of Science, India, 2007. IBM Faculty Award for research, teaching and initiative in Cryptology, 2007. Chairman, Steering Board, Indo-French Centre for Applied Mathematics (IFCAM), Department of Science and Technology, Government of India and The National Center for Scientific Research, Government of France, since 2013. Member, Scientific Council, Indo-French Centre for the Promotion of Advanced Research (CEFIPRA), Department of Science and Technology, Government of India and Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of France, since 2013. Member, India-Japan Science Council, Department of Science and Technology (DST), Government of India, since 2013. Board Member, National Board for Higher Mathematics (NBHM), since 2012. Member, UNESCO Technical Advisory Committee, Asia-Pacific, since 2009. Member, Program Advisory Committee for Mathematical Sciences, Department of Science and Technology (DST), Government of India, 2007â2012. Adviser for Secure Wireless Communication, Special Protection Group (SPG), Government of India, 2006â2007. Member, Technical Advisory Committee for Surveys, Reserve Bank of India (RBI), Government of India, since 2007-2015. Member, Governing Council, National Sample Survey Organization (NSSO), Government of India, 2002â2006. Member, Board for Security and Assurance, National Association of Software and Service Companies (NASSCOM), since 2004. Founder-Secretary, Cryptology Research Society of India, since inception in 2001. Member, International Association for Cryptologic Research, since 2000. Editorial Responsibilities Associate Editor, Journal of Ad Hoc & Sensor Wireless Networks. Associate Editor, Journal of Wireless Sensor Networks. Associate Editor, Research & Reviews: Journal of Statistics. My primary research interest involves all aspects of Statistics and its applications. Currently I am working on Combinatorics, and application of Statistics in Cryptology and Design of Experiments. Supervised thirteen (13) PhD theses in four different technical areas -- 3 in Statistics, 7 in Computer Science, 1 in Mathematics and 2 in Statistical Applications. PhD Students Srimanta Bhattacharyya Mrinal Nandi (Graduated 2015) Vignesh T S (Graduated 2015) Samiran Bag (Graduated 2015) Rishiraj Bhattacharyya (Graduated 2011) Sushmita Ruj (Graduated 2009) Dibyendu Chakrabarti (Graduated 2008) Amir Hossain (Graduated 2008 from Jadavpur University) Mridul Nandi (Graduated 2005) Avishek Adhikari (Graduated 2004) Soumen Maiti (Graduated 2001) Subhamoy Maitra (Graduated 1999) Tridib Dutta (Graduated 1992) Dipankar Basu (Graduated 1991 from Jadavpur University) Teaching has always been my passion, and I love teaching various courses on Statistics, Combinatorics and Cryptography at the Bachelors and Masters level. Taught at Indian Statistical Institute for over 30 years, since 1984. Taught at almost all degree courses offered at the Institute â B.Stat., M.Stat., M.Math., M.Tech.(CS), M.Tech.(QR&OR) and M.S.(QE) â at almost every possible level. Taught more than 60 courses, including almost all courses related to Statistics and Computer Science offered at all undergraduate and postgraduate levels of the Institute. Pioneered Cryptology education in India. Taught the subject through numerous courses, lectures, popular talks, seminars and workshops, and promoted this niche subject area. Supervised over fifty (50) Masters dissertations in four different technical areas -- Master of Statistics, Master of Mathematics, Master of Technology in Computer Science, and Master of Technology in Quality, Reliability and Operations Research. Published around forty (40) papers in refereed Journals; around twenty (20) book chapters, including proceedings for International Conferences; with over twenty (20) papers in Cryptology and Information Security, in reputed International Conferences and Journals.
